org.sbml.jsbml.util

Class StringTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sbml.jsbml.util.StringTools
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FormulaCompiler, FormulaCompiler, LaTeXCompiler, LaTeXCompiler

    public class StringTools
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides a collection of convenient methods for manipulating Strings.
    Since:
    0.8
    Author:
    Andreas Dräger, Nicolas Rodriguez, Clemens Wrzodek

      • concat

        public static final java.lang.StringBuffer concat(java.lang.Object... things)
        This method concatenates two or more Object Strings (obtained by calling Object.toString() if the current Object is not null) into a new StringBuffer.
        Parameters:
        things - to be concatenated
        Returns:
        a new StringBuffer containing all the string-representations of all given Objects.

      • getWordForNumber

        public static java.lang.String getWordForNumber(long number)
        Returns the number as an English word. Zero is converted to "no". Only positive numbers from 1 to twelve can be converted. All other numbers are just converted to a String containing the number.
        Parameters:
        number -
        Returns:

      • leadingZeros

        public static java.lang.String leadingZeros(int length,
                                            int number)
        This method creates a String representation of the given number and inserts as many zero characters as the prefix of this String as needed to result in a String of the given length.
        Parameters:
        length - the total desired length of the given number String.
        number -
        Returns:
        a String of the given length consisting of a suffix defined by the given number and as many leading zeros as necessary to reach the desired length.

        Parameters:
        length - the desired length of the resulting String
        symbol - the symbol to be inserted at the beginning of the initial String multiple times.
        initialString - can be null or empty.

      • parseSBMLBoolean

        public static boolean parseSBMLBoolean(java.lang.String valueAsStr)
        Parses a String into a boolean following the rules of the SBML specifications, section 3.1.2.
        Parameters:
        valueAsStr - a boolean as a String
        Returns:
        the String as a boolean. If the String is not a valid boolean, false is returned.

      • parseSBMLBooleanStrict

        public static boolean parseSBMLBooleanStrict(java.lang.String valueAsStr)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Parses a String into a boolean following the rules of the SBML specifications, section 3.1.2.
        Parameters:
        valueAsStr - a boolean as a String
        Returns:
        the String as a boolean. If the String is not a valid boolean an exception is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String cannot be converted into a boolean.

      • parseSBMLDouble

        public static double parseSBMLDouble(java.lang.String valueAsStr)
        Parses a String into a double number following the rules of the SBML specifications, section 3.1.5.
        Parameters:
        valueAsStr - a double as a String
        Returns:
        the String as a double. If the String is not a valid double number, Double.NaN is returned.

      • parseSBMLDoubleStrict

        public static double parseSBMLDoubleStrict(java.lang.String valueAsStr)
        Parses a String into a double number following the rules of the SBML specifications, section 3.1.5.
        Parameters:
        valueAsStr - a double as a String
        Returns:
        the String as a double. If the String is not a valid double number, an exception is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String cannot be converted into a double.

      • parseSBMLInt

        public static int parseSBMLInt(java.lang.String valueAsStr)
        Parses a String into an int number following the rules of the SBML specifications, section 3.1.3.
        Parameters:
        valueAsStr - an int as a String
        Returns:
        the String as an int. If the String is not a valid int number, 0 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String cannot be converted into an int.

      • parseSBMLShort

        public static short parseSBMLShort(java.lang.String value)
        Parses a String into an short number following the rules of the SBML specifications, section 3.1.3.
        Parameters:
        value - an int as a String
        Returns:
        the String as an short. If the String is not a valid short number, 0 is returned.

      • parseSBMLShortStrict

        public static short parseSBMLShortStrict(java.lang.String value)
        Parses a String into an short number following the rules of the SBML specifications, section 3.1.3.
        Parameters:
        value - an int as a String
        Returns:
        the String as an short. If the String is not a valid short number, 0 is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String cannot be converted into a short.

        Returns:

      • toString

        public static final java.lang.String toString(double value)
        Returns a String from the given value that does not contain a point zero at the end if the given value represents an integer number. The returned String displays the number in a Locale -dependent way, i.e., the decimal separator and the symbols to represent the digits are chosen from the system's configuration. Furthermore, a scientific style including 'E' will be used if the value is smaller than 1E-5 or greater than 1E5.
        Parameters:
        value -
        Returns:

      • toString

        public static final java.lang.String toString(java.util.Locale locale,
                                              double value)
        Allows for Locale-dependent number formatting.
        Parameters:
        locale -
        value -
        Returns:

      • toXMLNotesString

        public static java.lang.String toXMLNotesString(java.lang.String notes)
        Checks whether a given String fits into the definition of the XML notes String in SBML. If not, this method will surround the given String with the minimal definition of a valid notes String.
        Parameters:
        notes - the String to be checked and possibly modified.
        Returns:
        A String that will be surrounded by the XML definition of a notes String in SBML, i.e., 
         <notes>
   <body xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
     <p>the original notes</p>
   </body>
 </notes>
        If the given argument already suffices the definition of XML Strings in SBML, nothing will be changed.

      • toXMLMessageString

        public static java.lang.String toXMLMessageString(java.lang.String message)
        Checks whether a given String fits into the definition of the XML message String in SBML. If not, this method will surround the given String with the minimal definition of a valid message String.
        Parameters:
        message - the String to be checked and possibly modified.
        Returns:
        A String that will be surrounded by the XML definition of a notes String in SBML, i.e., 
         <message>
   <body xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">
     <p>the original message</p>
   </body>
 </message>
        If the given argument already suffices the definition of XML Strings in SBML, nothing will be changed.

      • toXMLAnnotationString

        public static java.lang.String toXMLAnnotationString(java.lang.String annotation)
        Checks whether a given String fits into the definition of the XML annotation String in SBML. If not, this method will surround the given String with the minimal definition of a valid annotation String.
        Parameters:
        annotation - - the String to be checked and possibly modified.
        Returns:
        the argument surrounded by the annotation XML element if needed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the String passed as argument is not XML
